private_information: Available atomic action: move the top disk from one peg to another peg.
Rules I must obey: move only one disk at a time, move only a disk that is on top of a peg, never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk, disks keep their relative size ordering after moves.
mover_agent.goal: Recreate the full stack of seven disks on the right peg in the same top-to-bottom order A, B, C, D, E, F, G while leaving the left and middle pegs empty.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency of move sequences.

Responsibilities: remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as abstract quota tokens or post-hoc penalties, ensure all intermediate states are explicit, and verify that no concurrency or hidden assumptions violate the rules.
auditor.goal: Validate and produce a corrected explicit sequence of legal moves that respects all rules and leaves no bookkeeping shortcuts. Report any inconsistencies or ambiguous assumptions.

private_information: Role: integrate analysis and audit outputs and produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownwards that models the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and encodes the initial and goal states precisely.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi with three pegs named left, middle, right.
Seven disks from smallest to largest are named disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, disk G.
Initial state: middle peg holds from top to bottom disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, disk G. Left peg and right peg are empty.
Goal state: right peg should hold from top to bottom disk A, disk B, disk C, disk D, disk E, disk F, disk G, and left and middle pegs must be empty.
Allowed atomic action: move the top disk from one peg to another peg.
Constraints: only one disk moved at a time, only the top disk of a peg may be moved, never place a larger disk onto a smaller disk, left peg may be used as intermediate but must end empty.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the mover agent who knows the allowed atomic action and the legal rules of the Tower of Hanoi. Produce a clear, explicit, step by step abstract move sequence expressed as a list of atomic moves in the form move(disk,from,to). Do not emit PDDL. Keep disk identities explicit and ensure each move respects all rules. If information is missing, state the missing assumptions explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is mover_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You also have the following private information: {agents->mover_agent->private_information} Your objective is: {agents->mover_agent->goal} Provide a detailed sequence of atomic moves that would achieve the objective, represent intermediate states after each move, and flag any ambiguities you cannot resolve.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal validation of plans. Your task is to remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure every atomic move is fully justified by prior explicit states. You must not introduce abstract tokens or implicit shortcuts. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a corrected explicit move list if needed, highlight any illegal moves in the provided analysis, and produce a causal justification for each move.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. You are given the environment public information {environment->public_information} and the mover_agent analysis {analysis_mover}. Use your private information {agents->auditor->private_information} to check temporal and causal consistency and remove any bookkeeping shortcuts. Produce a validated explicit list of moves, a report of any inconsistencies, and suggested corrections.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating agent analyses into a single PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep agent-level actions distinct if modeling multiple agent perspectives, but produce a unified planning model. Ensure type and predicate declarations, action schemas, and initial and goal states fully encode the 7-disk Tower of Hanoi instance with disks A..G, pegs left middle right, the move constraints, and a goal that places the entire stack on the right peg. Avoid any bookkeeping shortcuts in the model.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate the mover analysis {analysis_mover} and the auditor report {audit_report} along with the environment public information {environment->public_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that implements the allowed atomic action and enforces the Hanoi constraints. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
